title: Accessibility Audit Phase 1
description: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance review of core user flows — the audit nobody requested until legal did.

outcomes.clear_success: Three screen-reader users moved from frustrated to functional, and everyone else never noticed; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Alt text was added to 60% of images; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: We discovered 8% of users were blocked by color-only validation errors; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: WCAG compliance achieved in staging; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: The audit revealed the settings page is completely inaccessible and fixing it properly will cost 40 unbudgeted hours; legal wants a meeting.

title: Mobile Responsive Fixes
description: Fix layout breaks on viewports 375px and below, because it turns out people still use phones to do things.

outcomes.clear_success: Mobile NPS improved three points; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Buttons are tappable now and modals still overflow, but we call that a scrolling experience; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Users on 6-inch phones report better navigation; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Responsive design is now mostly compliant and there is a tablet breakpoint nobody owns anymore; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: The sticky header fix broke input focus on iPhone 12; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Loading State Clarity
description: Replace vague spinners with contextual loading messages and skeleton screens so users know the app is working, not frozen.

outcomes.clear_success: Users stopped asking is it loading and started asking how much longer; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Skeleton screens exist on three pages and the other twelve still spin like they could mean anything; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: One user thanked us for the loading message; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: Loading states are more informative, but faster load times would be more informative still; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: Estimated wait times are hardcoded to five seconds and queries that take 45 seconds now look broken; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Error Messages Rewrite
description: Replace cryptic error strings with messages that actually help users instead of scaring them.

outcomes.clear_success: Support tickets dropped 12% for common errors; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Form validation errors are now human readable and API errors still look like stack traces because that is someone else's system; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Users learned what a webhook is and the error message for it was better than our documentation; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: The happy path is clearer and the unhappy path is still mystifying; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: New error copy shipped with placeholder support links; update your resume.

title: Color Contrast Audit
description: Design and implement a responsive, modular dashboard that works on every viewport and doesn't make designers cry.

outcomes.clear_success: Users with low vision can read the interface now and the subtle gray-on-gray aesthetic is now merely subtle; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Primary text passed AA and secondary labels still fail on specific monitors; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: The new palette accidentally made the app look more professional and everyone thinks we rebranded; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Light mode is compliant and dark mode is aspirationally accessible; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: Remapping colors broke custom themes and users with red-green colorblindness lost contrast in data visualizations; legal wants a meeting.

title: Keyboard Navigation Improvements
description: Implement proper tab order, focus indicators, and keyboard shortcuts so the product is usable without a mouse.

outcomes.clear_success: Power users found the shortcuts — one person is now 200% more efficient at a task nobody should optimize for; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Tab order is logical on forms but still mysterious in navigation; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: A user without a mouse had a noticeably better experience — everyone else uses a mouse, so this is invisible; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Keyboard navigation works in the main flow; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: The Tab key now skips through 47 hidden elements before reaching content; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Settings Page Redesign
description: Consolidate five different upload flows into one consistent drag-and-drop experience with progress indicators.

outcomes.clear_success: Users found settings 40% faster; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Settings are organized logically and the preview panel only works for themes, not for notifications or data retention; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Three users discovered features they did not know existed and two of them were unintentional discoveries; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: The redesign is an improvement over the previous chaos and it is still not self-explanatory; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: Settings is now inviting enough that users tweak advanced options they do not understand and support volume increased 8%; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Empty State Design System
description: Create consistent messaging and illustrations for blank pages, zero-result searches, and no-data scenarios.

outcomes.clear_success: First-time users are no longer confused by blank screens; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Empty states have helpful messages on 70% of pages; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: The new illustrations became an internal meme and the design team's intent no longer matters; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Empty states are no longer bleak — they're now minimally encouraging in a way that feels passive-aggressive; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: The no-data illustration offended roughly half the company, and HR is now in a thread about it that will never end; update your resume.

title: Onboarding Tooltip Pass
description: Audit and refresh contextual tooltips for first-time feature discovery — standardize tone, timing, and the art of not being annoying.

outcomes.clear_success: Tooltips are consistent and helpful; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Timing improved on critical flows, but half the tooltips still pop up mid-task to demand attention; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Someone customized tooltips for their account and it broke experiment metrics, but they are happy; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Tooltips are clearer but less discoverable and the tradeoff feels wrong even if the math says it is fine; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: A tooltip bug shows the same message on different features and users assume the features are the same; legal wants a meeting.

title: Search UX Overhaul
description: Add autocomplete, result previews, filter chips, and fuzzy matching to search so it actually helps people find things.

outcomes.clear_success: Search success rate improved 28%; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Autocomplete works beautifully and fuzzy matching catches 85% of misspellings; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Users discovered they can search for things that do not exist and are mad we made it easy to find nothing; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: Search is faster but still not fast enough and users perceive a 200ms delay with supernatural accuracy; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: Recent search history leaked internal admin queries into user autocomplete and privacy incident, low severity, still an incident; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Form Validation Redesign
description: Move validation to real-time inline feedback instead of submit-time walls and add success states for completed fields.

outcomes.clear_success: Form abandonment dropped 15%; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Real-time validation works on text inputs and dropdowns still validate on submit because the codebase is old; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: A user sent a thank-you email about instant email validation; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Validation is friendlier but users still cannot tell if red means wrong or required without trying; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: Checkmarks are so cheerful that users submit incomplete forms thinking they're done — actual completion dropped; update your resume.

title: Dark Mode Implementation
description: Implement dark mode with system preference detection, user toggle, and WCAG-compliant colors in both themes.

outcomes.clear_success: Night-shift NPS improved five points; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Dark mode works, but some components were not updated and light buttons on dark backgrounds are now a design choice; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: OLED power consumption dropped and nobody measured it; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Dark mode is available but buggy in PDF exports and it is not a common use case, but someone is doing it; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: Dark mode broke the custom theme system and users with saved themes now live in an unusable gray void; legal wants a meeting.

title: Notification Center Redesign
description: Consolidate notifications from multiple sources into a unified center and add filtering by type and priority.

outcomes.clear_success: Notification overload dropped 40%; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: The center is unified, but preferences only control 60% of notification types — the other 40% are system-critical; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Users discovered they can silence notifications, and several people are now missing critical alerts; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Notifications are better organized, but delivery still arrives in random order because the queue does what it wants; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: The preferences UI is so good at hiding alerts that a critical security notification went unseen for two weeks; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Page Transition Animations
description: Add smooth page transition animations that respect prefers-reduced-motion, because polish matters even if nobody can prove it in a metric.

outcomes.clear_success: Navigation feels smoother, though users on 2G connections experience brief freezes; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Transitions are smooth on modern browsers and safari 2019 still looks choppy, but that is not our target audience; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: One user with vestibular disorder disabled motion and thanked us; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: Animations are under 300ms; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: Animations caused layout shift on mobile and CLS went up, complaints went up, performance did not change; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Data Table Redesign
description: Improve sortable columns, add column visibility toggle, implement sticky headers.

outcomes.clear_success: Data-heavy workflows are 30% faster; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Tables are beautiful and functional; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: The column visibility toggle is so good that users hid critical columns and forgot they were hidden; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Tables are great on desktop and mobile card view is a half-measure that is better than nothing but not ideal; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: Sticky headers broke absolutely positioned elements inside cells; update your resume.

title: Empty State Microcopy
description: Rewrite empty states with clear next steps and example data — tiny effort, much less confusion.

outcomes.clear_success: Empty states tell users exactly what to do next and support tickets dropped; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Half the empty states are helpful, the other half still say no data and users are less confused, but not unconfused; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Users copy the example data verbatim and three demos now feature the same fictional customer name; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Copy is better, but setup is still hard and users read the instructions; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: A localization bug replaced empty-state copy with raw template tokens and every screen looked broken in three languages; legal wants a meeting.

title: CDN Migration Plan
description: Migrate static assets from self-hosted servers to a global CDN with proper cache headers and versioning.

outcomes.clear_success: APAC regions load 50% faster; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Most assets are on the CDN and SVG files are still self-hosted because nobody owns the icon system anymore; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Cache invalidation is now a problem we can see and before, it was a problem we could not measure; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: The CDN works but edge cases exist and users in certain regions get stale assets for reasons we do not understand yet; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: A CDN misconfiguration cached the API response and every user saw the same data for 45 minutes; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Auto-Scaling Configuration
description: Set up horizontal pod autoscaling based on CPU and memory thresholds, with burst limits and cooldown periods configured.

outcomes.clear_success: The system scales automatically during traffic spikes; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Auto-scaling works for stateless services — stateful services still scale manually because no one wants to automate that; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Cost increased during the test spike; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Scaling works but takes 90 seconds to activate; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: A cascading failure caused rapid scale-out followed by rapid scale-in; update your resume.

title: Database Read Replicas
description: Deploy database read replicas for reporting and analytics queries so the primary stops sweating during dashboard refreshes.

outcomes.clear_success: Primary database CPU dropped 35%; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Read replicas work for analytics, but consistency adds 2-5 seconds of lag and breaks freshness expectations; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: A user discovered they could query stale data from the replica, built a workflow around it, and complained when we fixed it; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Replicas work most of the time and during network partitions you choose between stale data; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: A replica fell out of sync with primary, and for 40 minutes analytics reported fabricated numbers; legal wants a meeting.

title: Disaster Recovery Testing
description: Run monthly disaster recovery drills simulating complete region failure — test restores, failover, and RTO/RPO metrics before you need them for real.

outcomes.clear_success: We discovered we could recover in 45 minutes; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: DR playbooks exist and half are outdated; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: The first drill accidentally broke production — everyone learned something valuable about the difference between staging and prod; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Recovery procedures work but require manual steps and people who know the system, so they are fragile by nature; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: A restore test corrupted the backup and we spent 36 hours discovering our disaster recovery plan was itself a disaster; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Load Balancer Optimization
description: Tune load balancer connection limits, timeouts, and health checks, and implement connection draining for graceful shutdowns.

outcomes.clear_success: Request routing is more efficient and failed connections dropped 60%; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Health checks are better and false positives still happen during GC pauses in production; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Tracing headers revealed users send malformed requests we never noticed and everything still works anyway; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: The load balancer is optimized; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: The new timeout was too aggressive and long-running reports failed; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Log Aggregation Pipeline
description: Centralize logs from all services into a structured logging platform so debugging doesn't require checking five different systems.

outcomes.clear_success: Log searchability improved from nonexistent to useful and debugging is now 40% less painful; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Most services log correctly and legacy services still write unstructured logs that make parsing impossible; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: We can now see exactly how often users hit error paths and the numbers are higher than anyone expected; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Centralized logging works and retaining six months of logs costs more than expected; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: The logging pipeline started dropping events under load; update your resume.

title: Container Orchestration Migration
description: Migrate from manual container management to Kubernetes — stateful sets, config maps, persistent volumes, the whole party.

outcomes.clear_success: Kubernetes now runs 80% of services; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Orchestration works and PersistentVolume claims still glitch; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Kubernetes manages resources so well that developers stopped thinking about resource usage entirely; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Services migrate smoothly until one stateful service sits in CrashLoopBackOff for three hours and confuses everyone; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: A misconfigured StatefulSet replica corrupted data — recovery took 18 hours; legal wants a meeting.

title: Blue-Green Deployment Setup
description: Implement blue-green deployments for zero-downtime releases with automated traffic switching and rollback.

outcomes.clear_success: Deployments happen without downtime and release anxiety dropped; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Blue-green works for stateless services and stateful services still require manual coordination; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Instant rollback made developers more confident about shipping and bug fix velocity increased 25%; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Zero-downtime deploys work, but database migrations still require downtime windows; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: A green deploy contained a load-only bug; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Service Mesh Implementation
description: Deploy a service mesh for inter-service communication, circuit breaking, and observability — start with canary rollout to 20% of traffic.

outcomes.clear_success: Circuit breakers prevent cascading failures and the infrastructure is resilient in ways that are impossible to appreciate on a quiet day; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Service mesh is deployed to 20% of traffic; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: The mesh added 50ms of latency; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: The mesh works but adds complexity and only two people understand its configuration; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: A mesh rule misconfiguration caused traffic to loop and services talked to themselves for eight minutes until retry storms crashed them; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: API Gateway Deployment
description: Deploy a centralized API gateway for routing, rate limiting, and authentication to replace the current chaos of direct service endpoints.

outcomes.clear_success: The API gateway is the single point of control and rate limiting actually works; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: The gateway routes traffic correctly and authentication still happens at the service level because migration is incomplete; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Gateway metrics revealed that 30% of API traffic is from unknown sources; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: The gateway works but it's another layer in the stack that can fail between the user and their data; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: The rate limiter was too strict and legitimate bulk operations got 429s for an hour during migration; legal wants a meeting.

title: Distributed Caching Layer
description: Deploy a Redis cluster for distributed caching with a cache invalidation strategy that someone has actually thought through.

outcomes.clear_success: Database load dropped 35%; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Caching works beautifully and cache invalidation is still wrong in three places; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Redis became a single point of failure and we are not prepared for that failure; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Caching increases hits and stale data is occasionally served but it is cache-level stale, so we call it acceptable; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: Redis ran out of memory during a traffic spike — everything fell to cache misses and the database melted; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Observability Platform Upgrade
description: Implement distributed tracing across all services and upgrade metrics platform with better cardinality handling.

outcomes.clear_success: Distributed tracing shows request paths across the system and debugging time dropped 40%; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Tracing works for most paths and async tasks still lack good trace context; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Observability data revealed that 15% of requests time out at layer seven; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: The platform is more observable and some teams still do not know how to read the dashboards; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: Cardinality explosion overloaded the metrics database; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Backup Automation Enhancement
description: Automate incremental backups with retention policies and test weekly restores to staging, because untested backups are just hope.

outcomes.clear_success: Backups are automated and verified weekly; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Backups work automatically, but retention still deletes anything older than 30 days; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Incremental backups saved 60% of storage costs; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Automated backups are reliable and they run at random times; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: A restore test corrupted data and we now had the original problem; update your resume.

title: Performance Profiling Tools
description: Set up continuous CPU and memory profiling in production so performance issues are visible before customers report them.

outcomes.clear_success: Profiling revealed one function consuming 35% of CPU; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Profiling works but overhead is noticeable and we enable it only during off-peak hours; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Flame graphs are beautiful and engineers stare at them; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Profiling is accurate and you just need to know how to read it; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: Profiling overhead caused a timeout cascade during a traffic spike and we turned it off; legal wants a meeting.

title: Network Security Audit
description: Audit firewall rules, network segmentation, and ingress policies, then implement pod-to-pod network policies for the parts that are currently wide open.

outcomes.clear_success: Network is segmented properly and TLS certificates rotate automatically; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Network policies exist and debugging blocked traffic takes longer than implementing the rules did; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: The audit found services talking to things they should not and breaking those links revealed unused dependencies; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Security posture improved and operational complexity rose proportionally; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: A network policy typo isolated a critical service and database connections failed; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Alert Deduping Rules
description: Add alert deduplication and noise-suppression rules for on-call — low effort, immediate sanity gains for the humans holding pagers.

outcomes.clear_success: Pager noise dropped 40%; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Duplicate alerts are mostly gone and the remaining ones are the worst offenders; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Noise rules suppressed a real incident for 15 minutes; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: Deduping only applied to one service and everything else still screams; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: A deduping rule swallowed a critical outage alert; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Keyboard Navigation Overhaul
description: The product is basically unusable without a mouse — add keyboard shortcuts and tab navigation for power users and accessibility.

outcomes.clear_success: Keyboard navigation shipped and power users are delighted; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Core workflows have keyboard shortcuts but edge cases still require mouse; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Keyboard shortcuts conflicted with browser shortcuts and users accidentally closed tabs; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Shortcuts exist but are undiscoverable and usage is under 5%; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: A focus trap bug locked users in a modal and the only escape was refreshing the page; update your resume.

title: Kubernetes Migration
description: Migrate from EC2 instances to Kubernetes for better resource utilization and auto-scaling — the infrastructure team has been asking for a year.

outcomes.clear_success: K8s migration complete and infrastructure costs dropped 28%; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Core services on K8s and legacy services still on EC2; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Auto-scaling worked too well and scaled to zero during low traffic, taking the site down; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: Migration complete but debugging is harder and mean time to resolution increased; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: A pod configuration error caused cascading failures across services; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Design System Documentation
description: The design system exists but documentation is scattered across Figma, Notion, and one designer's head — centralize it before they quit.

outcomes.clear_success: Design system docs launched and onboarding time for new designers dropped 60%; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Core components documented and edge cases are still tribal knowledge; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Documentation revealed inconsistencies in the design system that nobody wanted to acknowledge; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Docs exist but are already out of sync with the latest components; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: A deprecated component was documented as current and three teams built features using it; update your resume.

title: Real-Time Monitoring Dashboard
description: Build a real-time ops dashboard showing system health, API latency, and error rates — currently we find out about outages from Twitter.

outcomes.clear_success: Monitoring dashboard is live and mean time to detection dropped from 12 minutes to 45 seconds; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Dashboard works but alerts are noisy and the on-call rotation learned to ignore them; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Dashboard revealed that services are constantly in degraded state and nobody noticed; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Dashboard exists but metrics are delayed by 5 minutes and real-time is aspirational; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: A metrics aggregation bug showed all systems green during an outage; legal wants a meeting.
